content.webTitle: KPMG to pay £59m bonus to staff in UK

fields.headline: KPMG to pay £59m bonus to staff in UK
fields.bodyText: Staff at KPMG will share a multimillion-pound payout after the UK arm of the accountancy firm said yesterday a surge in business this year lifted revenues by a fifth. KPMG, which is to pay £255m to US regulators to settle allegations that it promoted illegal tax shelters, will pay its 8,950 UK staff £59m, compared with £35m last year. Revenues rose 20% to £1.28bn for the year. The global figures were 16.4% higher at £8.8bn. The firm has benefited from a rise in red tape as companies prepare for the new international financial reporting standards and Sarbanes-Oxley legislation in the US.
